lexUnit.name: tall.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: how far the distance is from the base of an object to its top-most point (used with a number)

sentence.text: She was just five feet tall , and fat .
Penelope Chilston was six feet tall , a plain , square-shouldered , big-thighed , fresh-faced girl , with a fringe and straight , dark brown hair .
She was six feet tall and looked like a gorgeous transvestite , possibly the beneficiary of some dirty-minded sex-change operation , over in California there .
For all her vitality , Faye was only five feet four inches tall , while Tom was a good ten inches taller .
She was only about five feet tall , if that , and the kid , a big healthy specimen , seemed to be only a few inches off the floor .
There is an unusual small catmint ( Nepeta phylloclamys ) next to some tiny lilies that grow only six inches tall , and a viola on a tall stem that E A Bowles wrote about .
Standing a magnificent 12 inches high , Action Man looks set to see off Ken -- Barbie 's beau -- who stands just 11 UNC inches tall .
She was seventeen , five-foot-ten inches tall and Bailey thought she looked Egyptian , ` Like Nefertiti " .
They were only about nine to fifteen inch tall do you see .
Some statues are 20 metres tall .
The guard , Tabitha saw as the searchlight swung away , was a robot three metres tall , covered in spikes .
The first uses large , two metres tall puppets which can be easily seen by large audiences .
Crying makes a lot of tears when you are three metres tall .
My creature was two and a half metres tall .
The instructions tell you not to remove the growing tip until the tree has reached the final size you require , do I presume I 'm stuck with a 2 UNC ft tall tree ?
Penry turned , his face set , as the door flew open and a tall woman in a clinging white dress paused theatrically on the threshold .
According to Tass , no less , the town was terrorised by visitors from outer space -- small-headed hominoids about 12ft tall who landed their flying saucer in the local park and then went walkabout .
It was a little before twelve noon , and the boys and girls in the green uniforms were circulating with tall glasses among the shade-seeking patients .
He rolled off her gently and went to open one of the tall windows , which creaked and rattled in protest at being disturbed abruptly after a winter 's hibernation .
The man in the tall hat was there .
It 's a comfortable car to drive , assisted by power steering , and while leg-room in the back is just about adequate the low roof can prove irritating for tall rear seat passengers .
` He was tall , blond and handsome , a real English gentleman , " Isabelle said .
` Amotju was so slim and tall , and you are built more like a warrior or a boatman than a scribe . "
She was eighteen , tall , dark and sweetly innocent .
A large man in every way , he was tall and big-bellied ; bellicose when fondest , hearty when not .
` He 's very tall and good-looking now , do n't you think ?
Your only problem might be if you are very tall and worry about what other people think .
